title: Endocardial Fibroelastosis: A Rare Pediatric Heart Disorder
short_description: Clinical overview of endocardial fibroelastosis (EFE), a rare congenital heart condition affecting infants and children characterized by thickening of the heart chamber lining.
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive clinical overview of endocardial fibroelastosis (EFE), a rare pediatric heart disorder that affects fewer than 1% of children with congenital heart disease. The text explains the pathophysiology involving thickening of the muscular lining of heart chambers due to increased connective tissue and elastic fibers, describes the normal heart anatomy for context, and discusses epidemiological data showing equal gender distribution and declining incidence since the 1960s. The document details diagnostic approaches including clinical evaluation, physical examination findings such as respiratory distress and abnormal heart rhythms, radiographic studies revealing cardiac enlargement, and electrocardiogram changes that indicate characteristic heart damage associated with EFE.
